questions.question: Baffles are fitted in aircraft fuel tanks:
options: a. to assist in correct fuel distribution
b. to prevent fuel surging during aircraft manoeuvres
c. to prevent the static build-up in the tank during refuelling
d. to channel fuel to the vent valve

questions.question: A power failure to a capacitive fuel contents system would cause the gauge to:
options: a. show full scale deflection high
b. fluctuate between high and low readings
c. remain fixed on the last contents noted before failure
d. show full scale deflection low

questions.question: A fuel booster pump, besides pumping fuel to the engine, can also be utilized to:
options: a. jettison and transfer fuel
b. jettison and heat the fuel
c. transfer and heat the fuel
d. transfer and recycle the fuel

questions.question: During fuel jettison, the aircraft is protected against running out of fuel by:
options: a. high level float switches
b. preset jettison quantity switches
c. the crew remaining alert
d. low level float switches

questions.question: To indicate that a refuelling bowser carries JET A1 aviation kerosene:
options: a. yellow and black stripes are marked on the refuelling hose
b. JET A1 would be painted in 30 cm high symbols on the side of the container
c. JET A1 is printed in white on a black background label positioned prominently on the vehicle
d. the driver wears a straw yellow water and fuel proof jacket

questions.question: Adjustments may have to made to an aircraft's engine fuel system if it has been refuelled with JET B instead of its normal JET A1 fuel, these adjustments are to cater for:
options: a. the change in the specific gravity of the fuel
b. the change in the calorific value of the fuel
c. the change in the viscosity of the fuel
d. the lack of HITEC lubricant in the fuel

questions.question:
The differences between AVGAS 100 and AVGAS 100LL are:
(Colour / Anti-knock value)
options: a. Same / Same
b. Same / Different
c. Different / Same
d. Different / Different

questions.question: The aircraft cannot be refuelled while:
options: a. a ground power unit is operating on the ramp
b. passengers are walking through the refuelling zones
c. passengers are boarding
d. the APU is running

questions.question: The disadvantage of refuelling the aircraft to "tanks full" the night before a departure in the heat of the day is that:
options: a. the change in the specific gravity may cause the aircraft to be overweight
b. the change in the volume of the fuel may cause it to spill through the vent system
c. the change in calorific value may reduce engine power to below sufficient
d. the rpm governor will be rendered inoperative

questions.question: An aircraft using MOGAS:
options: a. is likely to be affected by detonation at cruise power
b. must have booster pumps fitted in the fuel tanks
c. is more likely to be affected by vapour locking and carburettor icing
d. will suffer from a loss of power during take-off

questions.question: If a fuel sample appears cloudy or hazy, the most probable cause is:
options: a. water contamination
b. anti-microbiological additives
c. mixing different fuel grades
d. oil in the fuel

questions.question: On an aircraft equipped with a compensated capacitance type fuel quantity indication system graduated to read in kg, the temperature increases just after the tanks are half filled with fuel. If the fuel expands by 10%, the gauges will show:
options: a. an increase of 10%
b. a decrease of 10% of the volume factored by the new specific gravity
c. a decrease
d. the same amount

questions.question: The exhaust gases from the APU go into the refuelling zone. The APU:
options: a. must be switched OFF throughout the refuelling operation
b. can be started while refuelling is carried out.
c. must be started before fuelling is carried out, and can be run throughout the refuelling operation
d. can be started only after the refuelling operation has been terminated

questions.question: De-fuelled fuel:
options: a. can only be used in domestic heating systems
b. can only be used by aircraft from the same operators fleet
c. must be put back into storage
d. cannot be re-used until its quality has been verified

questions.question:
The background colour scheme for fuelling system pipelines carrying the following fuels is:
JET A1 / AVGAS
options: a. Red / Black
b. Black / Red
c. Red / Yellow
d. Yellow / Red

questions.question: AVGAS:
options: a. is coloured red for identification purposes
b. is coloured green if it is a leaded fuel and blue if it is a low lead fuel
c. has no artificial colouring and appears either clear or a straw yellow colour
d. can only be used in piston engines if oil is added to improve its anti-knock properties

questions.question: Information relating to the use of MOGAS can be found in:
options: a. CAA General Aviation Safety Sense Leaflets
b. Advisory Information Circulars
c. NOTAM
d. CAA Airworthiness Publications

questions.question: The fuel cross-feed valves are fitted in order to facilitate:
options: a. the use of fuel from any tank to any engine
b. refuelling when only one bowser is in use
c. isolation of the engine from the fuel system in the case of an engine fire
d. transfer of fuel between the main fuel tanks

questions.question: Refuelling with passengers on board is not permissible:
options: a. on a fixed wing aircraft
b. if AVGAS is being used
c. if the aircraft has more than twenty seats and the ratio of cabin attendants to passengers is greater than 1:50 and it is a wide bodied jet
d. in any of the above cases

questions.question: While refuelling with passengers on board, when a loading bridge is in use:
options: a. two sets of extra steps must be provided, one of which must be at the rear of the aircraft
b. the rear left or right door must be manned constantly by a cabin attendant ready for use as an emergency exit using the inflatable escape slide
c. ground servicing must not be carried out
d. catering and cleaning must not be carried out

questions.question: Modern jet aircraft fuel tanks are pressurized:
options: a. by air from the air conditioning system to prevent cavitation
b. by air from the engine compressor to prevent cavitation
c. by ram air to prevent cavitation
d. by ram air to stabilize the boiling point

questions.question: A "wide-cut" fuel is:
options: a. more flammable than a kerosene type fuel
b. less volatile than a kerosene type fuel
c. coloured red for identification purposes
d. commonly used in civilian transport aircraft

questions.question: The purpose of fitting baffles in fuel tanks is to:
options: a. prevent longitudinal movement of the fuel during acceleration
b. allow the booster pump to remain covered by fuel irrespective of the aircraft attitude
c. dampen lateral movement of the fuel in the wing tanks during a sideslip
d. maintain a pre-determined quantity of fuel in the outboard section of the wing tanks

questions.question: Fuel is heated:
options: a. to stop cavitation in the High Pressure fuel pump
b. to maintain a constant viscosity
c. to prevent water contamination
d. to stop ice blocking the Low Pressure fuel filter

questions.question: What is the function of a collector tank (feeder box)?
options: a. Prevent detonation during take-off
b. Prevent cavitation of the booster pumps
c. Prevent fuel surge due to extreme aircraft attitude
d. Allow suction feeding of the engine pump

questions.question: Fuel tank booster pumps are:
options: a. centrifugal, low pressure
b. centrifugal, high pressure
c. gear type, low pressure
d. gear type, high pressure

questions.question: The advantage of a capacitor type fuel contents gauging system is that the circuit:
options: a. responds to changes in specific gravity
b. compensates for high altitude flight
c. responds automatically to extremely low temperatures
d. compensates for aircraft attitude changes

questions.question: The Low Pressure engine driven pump:
options: a. backs up in case the engine High Pressure pump fails
b. backs up in case of a double booster pump failure
c. assists in the refuelling operation if only low pressure refuelling systems are available
d. pressurizes the fuel tanks to assist flow to the booster pumps

questions.question: The purpose of the fuel cooled oil cooler is to:
options: a. heat the oil and cool the fuel
b. heat the fuel and cool the oil
c. cool the oil
d. heat the fuel

questions.question: If a fuel tank with a capacitive quantity system was filled with water instead of fuel, the gauge would indicate:
options: a. full scale low (zero)
b. it would indicate the same as if it were filled with fuel
c. full scale high (max)
d. it would freeze at the last known indication

questions.question: AVTUR or JET A1:
options: a. varies in colour between clear and straw yellow
b. is a wide-cut fuel which is not normally used in civilian transport aircraft
c. is a gasoline type fuel with a high flash point
d. is a 97 octane fuel which prevents detonation in gas turbine engines

questions.question: When using which of the following fuels can refuelling be carried out with passengers on board?
options: a. Avtag
b. Jet B
c. Wide-cut
d. Jet A1

questions.question: With an increase in altitude the boiling point of fuel will:
options: a. stay the same
b. increase
c. decrease
d. increase up to FL80 then remain the same

questions.question: When refuelling an aircraft:
options: a. the refuelling nozzle must be bonded to the fuel tank
b. the bonding plug must be connected to the earth terminal
c. the continuity between nozzle and hose must be infinity
d. only use plastic nozzles
